meanings.definition: A unit of pressure equal to one thousandth of a bar.
meanings.sent1: The weather report mentioned that the pressure was measured in millibars.
meanings.sent2: The pilot checked the altimeter which displayed the pressure in millibars.
meanings.sent3: I tried to weigh a feather using millibars, but it didn't work!
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like a millibar waiting to burst.
meanings.sent5: The concept of millibars became clearer to me after studying meteorology.

meanings.definition: A unit of atmospheric pressure equal to one thousandth of a bar.
meanings.sent1: The meteorologist explained that the storm's intensity was measured in millibars.
meanings.sent2: The barometer showed a reading of 1000 millibars, indicating normal pressure.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my stress level could be measured in millibars on a bad day!
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a dropping millibar, signaling an approaching emotional storm.
meanings.sent5: The significance of millibars in predicting weather patterns fascinated me.
